Title: Kaduna has over 70 solid minerals for exploration, says commissioner
Summary: Kaduna has over 70 solid minerals for exploration, says commissioner . Kaduna State Government says it is intensifying efforts to harness its vast solid mineral resources .

Title: NDDC invests in legal studies to tackle Niger Delta challenges – Ogbuku
Summary: Niger Delta Development Commission (NDDC) has announced a significant investment in legal studies in the region . NDDC recognises the critical role that legal advocacy can play in highlighting the challenges confronting the Niger Delta and proffering creative solutions .

Title: NCAA says no drone certified for use in Nigeria
Summary: NCAA says no drone currently operating in the country has been certified by the regulatory body . Despite the existence of drone regulations dating back to 2017, the NCAA insists that none of the country's drones have been certified .

Title: Orientation agency urges further actions on JAMB’s errors
Summary: The Nigerian Orientation Agency urges further actions on JAMB’s errors . The Joint Admission Matriculation Board (JAMB) must initiate measures that will address the complaints and concerns of the candidates .

Title: Kwara shuts two Ilorin schools after student clashes
Summary: Kwara State Government has announced the immediate closure of Government High School and Government Day Secondary School, Adeta, Ilorin . The decision follows reports of violent clashes among students, disruption of academic activities .

Title: UK may set up migrant ‘return hubs’ in other nations – PM Starmer
Summary: UK will begin talks with other countries on "return hubs" for failed asylum seekers . UK may set up migrant ‘return hubs’ in other nations – PM Starmer .

Title: UTME results: JAMB should take responsibility for Timilehin’s death – NANS
Summary: Miss Timilehin Faith Opesusi committed suicide over poor scores in the recent Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examination, UTME . The National Association of Nigerian Students, NANS, has said the Joint Admissions and Matriculations Board, JAMB, should be held responsible for the death of Timilein Faith

Title: UTME Scandal: Peter Obi commends JAMB Registrar for transparency, accountability
Summary: Peter Obi commends Professor Ishaq Oloyede, the Registrar of the Joint Admission and Matriculation Board (JAMB), for being accountable to Nigerians over the 2025 UTME result scandal .

Title: Haaland eyes FA Cup to save face after Man City’s ‘horrific’ season
Summary: City face Crystal Palace at Wembley aiming to avoid a first trophyless campaign since Pep Guardiola's debut season in charge in 2016/17 . City face the Eagles in the FA Cup at Wembley .

Title: Russia calls Zelensky ‘clown’, ‘loser’ ahead of Turkey talks
Summary: Russia calls Zelensky ‘clown’, ‘loser’ ahead of Turkey talks . The exchange of personal barbs undermines the chances of any breakthrough at talks .

Title: Group hails soldiers' bravery in Borno military base attack
Summary: A civil society group, Prayer and Support for the Nigerian Armed Forces and other Security Agencies, has praised the military’s bravery in the recent terrorist attack on a military base in Malam-Fatori, Borno State . The PUNCH reported that the attack claimed the lives of at least five soldiers .

Title: TikTok creator jailed for naira abuse in Kaduna
Summary: A Federal High Court sitting in Kaduna has convicted and sentenced a content creator, Muhammad Kabir, for abusing and mutilating the Naira in a video shared on social media . The Economic and Financial Crimes Commission said Kabir was arrested on May 13, 2025, in the Tudun Wada area of Kaduna State .

Title: UTME glitches: Peter Obi highlights toll on students, commends Oloyede’s accountability
Summary: The 2023 Labour Party presidential candidate, Peter Obi, has commended the JAMB Registrar, Prof Ishaq Oloyede, for accountability and acknowledging the technical glitches affecting 379,997 UTME candidates . Obi, in a statement on X on Thursday, expressed concern over technical issues affecting critical institutions, while highlighting their detrimental impact

Title: UTME: Candidates with high scores share success secrets
Summary: Some candidates of the 2025 Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examinations, who scored above 340 overall and had over 90 marks in mathematics, have largely attributed their success to hard work . In separate interviews with the News Agency of Nigeria in Ibadan on Thursday, the candidates pinpointed prayer and commitment as other secrets behind their stories

Title: How Obasanjo crushed Boko Haram within weeks — Atiku
Summary: Former Vice President Atiku Abubakar has said that ex-President Olusegun Obasanjo swiftly ended Boko Haram’s activities when the group first emerged during their administration . Speaking in Abuja on Wednesday during a visit by stakeholders from Kogi East Senatorial District led by former Kogi Deputy Governor, Simon Ach
